intro: Ruellia asperula, commonly known as rough ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple, typically blooming in the summer months. Ruellia asperula is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or open areas. It is a perennial herb that can reach heights of up to 2 feet, making it a suitable candidate for ornamental gardening in suitable climates.
